comment: He was fair, when it came to emergencies or technical issues. I heard a lot of static about how he never replied back to students, but he always responded promptly when I emailed him. The test and quizzes were challenging and short timed but hey its an online class which is easy enough. The class was not hard. I got 100s on all the assignments.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you're taking Intro to C++ with Professor Khan, get ready to teach yourself! Professor Khan didn't actually do a lick of teaching the entire semester, instead relying on another professor's very old videos. Also, he will literally take 2+ months to grade your assignments, leaving you with no idea if you're doing things right or not. Avoid!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Not responsive, expect weeks for an email response. It will take a month to get a grade for a HW assnmnt. HW Labs arent too hard. Quizzes are difficult, you have very little time to read the question and select an answer. Do not expect to receive an Exam grade for about 2 months. Our class had to reach out to the department head for Exam 1 grades.

I keep forgetting my pillow to this class because of his mumbling during the lectures. He's a very knowledgeable guy but as a teacher, he is one of the worst. He teaches at his level of understanding so teaching yourself is the only way to learn. Please do not take him.

Does not: Give timely updates, give grades before class over, give understandable explanations, speak english well, write homework questions understandably, give clear criteria, give feedback for homework, give time for information digestion, give checkpoints for students to test themselves. Gave massive curves (appreciated) cause class failed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Get ready to barely understand anything this man says. Out of my whole college career in the IT Department, this is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. He will not grade anything until after the drop/add date. Will not elaborate any questions you ask. Syllabus is typically not his own nor does he point out what readings to do. limit text
